gs:source.gs:label: Atlas of the Cryosphere: Southern Hemisphere (WCS)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Snow and Ice Data Center

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Stroeve, J. and W. Meier. 1999, updated 2008. Sea Ice Trends and Climatologies from SMMR and SSM/I. Boulder, Colorado USA: National Snow and Ice Data Center. Digital media. Available at http://nsidc.org/data/smmr_ssmi_ancillary/monthly_means.html. Accessed 27 June 2008. Compiled from: Cavalieri, D., C. Parkinson, P. Gloersen, and H. J. Zwally. 1996. Sea ice concentrations from Nimbus-7 SMMR and DMSP SSM/I passive microwave data. Boulder, Colorado USA: National Snow and Ice Data Center. Digital media. Available at http://nsidc.org/data/nsidc-0051.html. Background: Monthly climatologies of sea ice concentration represent mean ice concentration percentages for each month over the entire time period 1979-2007, which is generated from passive microwave brightness temperature data derived from Nimbus-7 Scanning Multichannel Microwave Radiometer (SMMR) and Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (DMSP) -F8, -F11 and -F13 Special Sensor Microwave/Imager (SSM/I) radiances at a grid cell size of 25 x 25 km using the NASA Team algorithm developed by the Oceans and Ice Branch, Laboratory for Hydrospheric Processes at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC). A threshold of 15 percent concentration has been applied to the monthly climatologies.

                     xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"

                     xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.opengis.net/wcs http://schemas.opengis.net/wcs/1.0.0/describeCoverage.xsd">
  <CoverageOffering>
      <description>Stroeve, J. and W. Meier. 1999, updated 2008. Sea Ice Trends and Climatologies from SMMR and SSM/I. Boulder, Colorado USA: National Snow and Ice Data Center. Digital media. Available at http://nsidc.org/data/smmr_ssmi_ancillary/monthly_means.html. Accessed 27 June 2008. Compiled from: Cavalieri, D., C. Parkinson, P. Gloersen, and H. J. Zwally. 1996. Sea ice concentrations from Nimbus-7 SMMR and DMSP SSM/I passive microwave data. Boulder, Colorado USA: National Snow and Ice Data Center. Digital media. Available at http://nsidc.org/data/nsidc-0051.html. Background: Monthly climatologies of sea ice concentration represent mean ice concentration percentages for each month over the entire time period 1979-2007, which is generated from passive microwave brightness temperature data derived from Nimbus-7 Scanning Multichannel Microwave Radiometer (SMMR) and Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (DMSP) -F8, -F11 and -F13 Special Sensor Microwave/Imager (SSM/I) radiances at a grid cell size of 25 x 25 km using the NASA Team algorithm developed by the Oceans and Ice Branch, Laboratory for Hydrospheric Processes at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC). A threshold of 15 percent concentration has been applied to the monthly climatologies.</description>
      <name>sea_ice_concentration_01</name>
      <label>sea ice concentration, January (1979-2007)</label>
      <lonLatEnvelope srsName="urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC:1.3:CRS84">
         <gml:pos>-179.999998618863 -53.7717181062498</gml:pos>
         <gml:pos>178.854238518267 -34.9037152643753</gml:pos>
      </lonLatEnvelope>
      <keywords>

         <keyword>Cryosphere</keyword>
         <keyword>Earth Science</keyword>
         <keyword>Oceans</keyword>
         <keyword>Polar</keyword>
         <keyword>Sea Ice</keyword>
         <keyword>Sea Ice Concentration</keyword>
         <keyword>Southern Hemisphere</keyword>
         <keyword>Southern Ocean</keyword>
      </keywords>
      <domainSet>
         <spatialDomain>
            <gml:Envelope srsName="EPSG:4326">
               <gml:pos>-179.999998618863 -53.7717181062498</gml:pos>
               <gml:pos>178.854238518267 -34.9037152643753</gml:pos>
            </gml:Envelope>
            <gml:Envelope srsName="EPSG:3031">
               <gml:pos>-3961770.085 -3961769.906</gml:pos>
               <gml:pos>3961769.894 4362961.971</gml:pos>
            </gml:Envelope>
            <gml:RectifiedGrid dimension="2">
               <gml:limits>
                  <gml:GridEnvelope>
                     <gml:low>0 0</gml:low>
                     <gml:high>316 332</gml:high>
                  </gml:GridEnvelope>
               </gml:limits>
               <gml:axisName>x</gml:axisName>
               <gml:axisName>y</gml:axisName>
               <gml:origin>
                  <gml:pos>-3961770.085 4362961.971</gml:pos>
               </gml:origin>
               <gml:offsetVector>25000 0</gml:offsetVector>
               <gml:offsetVector>0 -25000</gml:offsetVector>
            </gml:RectifiedGrid>
         </spatialDomain>
      </domainSet>
      <rangeSet>
         <RangeSet>
            <description>0 = open water; 15-100 = % concentration (e.g. 50 = 50%); 253 = coastline; 254 = land mask; 255 = missing data</description>
            <name>pixels</name>
            <label>sea ice concentration</label>
         </RangeSet>
      </rangeSet>
      <supportedCRSs>
         <requestResponseCRSs>EPSG:3031</requestResponseCRSs>

      </supportedCRSs>
      <supportedFormats>

      </supportedFormats>
      <supportedInterpolations default="nearest neighbor">
         <interpolationMethod>nearest neighbor</interpolationMethod>
         <interpolationMethod>bilinear</interpolationMethod>
      </supportedInterpolations>
